edge_1: J. D. Is a part of Sullivan's soldiers and gets fatally shot in the ensuing gunfight.
edge_2: Sullivan's soldiers are summoned to rescue The Weavers, but they get attacked by the zombified cartel.

edge_1: Sullivan sacrifices himself so Patrick and Brax can escape during the gunfight.
edge_2: Patrick recognizes Lieutenant Sullivan as his father in the military platoon that captures him. This reveals a previously unknown relationship between the two.

edge_1: Sullivan sacrifices himself so Patrick and Brax can escape during the gunfight.
edge_2: Patrick sacrifices himself and falls on it to protect the others, paying homage to how his father died years ago: protecting his troop in Venezuela by falling onto a grenade.

edge_1: The remaining guests regroup at the resort but are cornered by Roarke, who reveals that they are in a fantasy in which they are all killed.
edge_2: Roarke's own fantasy is to be with his deceased wife, and he insists that the guests' fantasies be fulfilled to continue this one. This reveals a significant aspect of his character.

edge_1: Damon's associates send a plane to rescue the guests, but it is shot down.
edge_2: The guests run to the cave to destroy the glowing rock with a grenade Patrick is carrying.

edge_1: Julia is revealed to be Roarke's wife, brought back by the power of the island dying of a terminal disease she was suffering from when she met Roarke.
edge_2: Roarke's own fantasy is to be with his deceased wife, and he insists that the guests' fantasies be fulfilled to continue this one. This reveals a significant aspect of his character.
